intro: Tofieldia fusca, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, grassy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Tofieldia fusca is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
